answers.a: Yes—potassium acetate is highly soluble; it dissolves readily in water and is also soluble in alcohols.

answers.q: is potassium acetate soluble in water
answers.a: Yes; it is very soluble in water at room temperature.

answers.q: what does potassium acetate do in dna extraction
answers.a: In DNA extraction (e.g., alkaline lysis), potassium acetate with acetic acid neutralizes the lysate and precipitates SDS–protein–lipid complexes and denatured chromosomal DNA, leaving plasmid DNA in solution.

answers.q: what is potassium acetate used for
answers.a: As a food additive (E261), it’s used as a preservative and acidity regulator/buffering agent to inhibit microbial growth and help control pH. It is also used outside foods for runway de-icing and as a lab reagent.

answers.q: what is the formula for potassium acetate
answers.a: CH3COOK (also written as KC2H3O2 or KCH3COO).
